alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:14PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Douglas, east central Chelan and southern Okanogan Counties through 400 PM PDT... At 314 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chelan, or 29 miles northeast of Wenatchee, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chelan, Stayman, and Chelan Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
